name: PRETENTION, PT. II:
description: Yes, you're definitely reading that correctly...he misspelled pretension. But why? To make fun of pretentiousness in art, which is in itself a self-contained closed pretentious loophole system. I kind of have schadenfreude when it comes to pretentiousness in the art world. If you think I'm naming names, you're dead wrong. I might not be the most articulate pseudo-intellectual out there, but at least I'm a nice guy. What makes this work fun for me is that as the words get longer and longer, the collective shape takes on the form a cone. Pretentious art/artist are like these shapes, they put them up their...(whoaaaaaa there Andrew...that's not nice to say.) You're right readers, that's not nice to say to anyone. We here at the Andrew David Baron factory facilities profusely apologize for making direct accusations against pretentious artists and their art and trying to make them variant pariahs. What's that? Apology accepted? Thanks! Can I at least continue to misspell pretension to allude to this still? Yes? Oh great...thanks guys! You're the best readers ever.
